oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Luke Blackburn
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Luke Blackburn (horse) at Belle Meade Plantation, being held by stable hand.

Luke Blackburn (1877-1904), sired by Bonnie Scotland, was a racehorse who beat numerous records during his racing career. His major wins included the Champion Stakes (1880), Kenner Stakes (1880), Grand Union Prize (1880), Tidal Stakes (1880), and the United States Hotel Stakes (1880). He retired due to an injury and was sent to General William Hicks Jackson's Belle Meade Stud farm.
